ngiemboon: Máfùɔ we Samba la júʼ páʼ mé kíme fùɔ Salémo, ńdeen ńgʉa Yelúzálèm lélɔg mekwálʉʼʉ́ ńdʉŋte yé ńdɔg ńgyá zsénò yé. Pâ pʉ̀a tà ńgyɔ́ɔn la gwɔ́. À la tÿɔ́g mevɛ́ gyě á nkàʼ Mekamɛɛ mbɔɔ tʉ̌ ngɔ̂ɔ ńgÿo tʉ̀nzẅìŋ metǒon. Á la tóo mvfò fùɔ Salémo, ńzɛ́te yé menò mie ée tsɛ̀ɛ ntʉ́m yé.
en: The queen of Sheba heard of Solomon’s fame,   so she came to test Solomon with difficult questions at Jerusalem with a very large entourage, with camels bearing spices, gold in abundance, and precious stones. She came to Solomon and spoke with him about everything that was on her mind.

ngiemboon: Afùɔ Salémo pú ńkyagte menò mie à la ne ńzɛ́te, éshwóŋo yé. Á nue atsɔ́ la te mǒ tà ńgwɔ́ á cʉa fùɔ Salémo lékyagte wɔ́.
en: So Solomon answered all her questions; nothing was too difficult for Solomon to explain to her.

ngiemboon: Máfùɔ we Samba la gyá zsénò fùɔ Salémo, mbɔɔ ntí gie à la lɔg ńkwɛ́ɛ nɔʼ yé,
en: When the queen of Sheba observed Solomon’s wisdom, the palace he had built,

ngiemboon: ńgyá shúm léjÿó sie mé la tÿɔ́gɔ ndùm tápèle, mbɔɔ lelaʼá megàŋafàʼ pé. Ńgyá ntí gie pɔ́ lɔgɔ faʼa, mbɔɔ ntí menzsǒ mie megàŋafàʼ la maʼ, mbɔɔ me panéŋ mbwɔ̀ʼɔ. À la gyá ntí gie mé la lɔg ńtÿɔ́ʼte fùɔ, ńne ńdɔgɔ ḿbʉʉ né ndá Cʉ̀apʉ̀a, mɛ̌ menò gÿo, á pú ńgɔʼte tà ńtebe.
en: the food at his table, his servants’ residence, his attendants’ service and their attire, his cupbearers and their attire, and the burnt offerings he offered at the Lord’s temple, it took her breath away.

ngiemboon: Ńdeen ńké ńgɔɔn né fùɔ ngie: «Anò gie n ka tyé láʼ peg ńjúʼ, mé shwóŋe na gù, mbɔɔ na zsénò jú, á kaa nò nénʉ́.
en: She said to the king, “The report I heard in my own country about your words and about your wisdom is true.

ngiemboon: N da zɔɔn te zẅíŋe nò gie mé la shwóŋo wɔ́ɔn mɔ́, tà páʼ n tǒ tà ńtÿɔ́g nÿɔ́g mɔ́ɔn mǒ lɔɔn. Mé la zɔɔn te gʉa mǒ éshwóŋo wɔ́ɔn gwǒŋ na mɛ̂ menò wɔ́. Azsénò jú cʉa shúm ntsèm sie n da júʼ mé gɔɔn na gù.
en: But I didn’t believe their reports until I came and saw with my own eyes. Indeed, I was not even told half of your great wisdom! You far exceed the report I heard.

ngiemboon: Megàŋafàʼ pú ée pashÿó mbòŋo, pashÿó mbòŋo ée pʉ̀a pá pie é faʼa mbwó gù fʉ̀ʼ ntsèm, ḿbiŋ ne ńzẅíʼte meshwóŋè zsénò mú fʉ̀ʼ ntsèm.
en: How happy are your men.  ,# 9:7 1Kg 10:8 How happy are these servants of yours, who always stand in your presence hearing your wisdom.

ngiemboon: Pege ná ndǎg mbwó Cʉ̀apʉ̀a Ssé jù, á nue à la kwoŋo nò jú tá ńnéŋe gú na lʉŋe lefùɔ pa Ésàlayɛ! Cʉ̀apʉ̀a la kwoŋo láʼa Ésàlayɛ tà ńcʉ́me. Áa yɛ̌ tá à la lɔgɔ gú ńgÿo fùɔ, páʼ ɔ̀ ge lɔgɔ ndʉŋndʉŋ pɔ́ nò nénʉ́ é sáʼa láʼ.»
en: Blessed be the Lord your God! He delighted in you and put you on his throne as king for the Lord your God.   Because your God loved Israel enough to establish them forever, he has set you over them as king to carry out justice and righteousness.”  # 9:8 Dt 7:8; 2Ch 2:11

ngiemboon: Máfùɔ we Samba gɔɔn púʼu, ńnáa tʉ̌ ngɔ̂ɔ metónà méntá né tsěm, mbɔɔ mevɛ́ lɔg siŋ nnɛ́ tà é gyɔ́ɔn, ńgÿo metǒon tʉ̀nzẅìŋ. Etsɔ́ mevɛ́ gyě te gíŋ ńtó tà ńtɔ́g mie máfùɔ we Samba la náa mbwó fùɔ Salémo wɔ́.
en: Then she gave the king four and a half tons   of gold, a great quantity of spices, and precious stones. There never were such spices as those the queen of Sheba gave to King Solomon.

ngiemboon: Megàŋafàʼ fùɔ Hilam mbɔɔ pe fùɔ Salémo pie é lɔ́ɔn ńdɔgɔ metʉ̌ ngɔ̂ɔ, éfóo láʼa Ofîi ńtóo, é lɔ̌ɔn ńgíŋe ńdɔgɔ nkẅíŋ tÿǒ shʉ́a ńtóo tà é gyɔ́ɔn, mbɔɔ metǒon tʉ̀nzẅìŋ.
en: In addition, Hiram’s servants and Solomon’s servants who brought gold from Ophir   also brought algum wood and precious stones.

ngiemboon: Afùɔ Salémo lɔg mekèm tÿǒ shʉ́a ŋwɛ́ ńnyɛte mesetɔ̂b na ncwò ndá Cʉ̀apʉ̀a, mbɔɔ na ye, tà mbɔɔ mekèkÿɛ̀ lâ memándèle ńtí pagwaa zɔ̀b. Mé laa zɔɔn ńgyá tsɔ́ púʼu á tsɛ̀ɛ ngwòŋ pà Yúndà wɔ́.
en: The king made the algum wood into walkways for the Lord’s temple and for the king’s palace and into lyres and harps for the singers. Never before had anything like them been seen in the land of Judah.

ngiemboon: Afùɔ Salémo la pú ńná shúm ntsèm sie máfùɔ we Samba la ne ńtsɔ́ɔn lélúɔ, ńná tà é tɔ́g shúm sie à la náa mbwó fùɔ. Máfùɔ we Samba pâ megàŋafàʼ pé leen ńké ḿbiŋ né láʼ pɔ́b.
en: King Solomon gave the queen of Sheba her every desire, whatever she asked #— #far more than she had brought the king. Then she, along with her servants, returned to her own country.

ngiemboon: Á lɔ́ɔn ńgee ngùʼ ntsèm, mé náa tʉ̌ ngɔ̂ɔ metónà móm mbʉ́a á mbwó fùɔ Salémo á Yelúzálèm;
en: The weight of gold that came to Solomon   annually was twenty-five tons,  # 9:13 Lit 666 talents

ngiemboon: té sáŋ mencùb mie é lɔ́ɔn éfóo na shúm sie éfóo metúmo ndyɛ̀ʼɛ, mbɔɔ se patáŋ sɔ̌ɔn, tà mbɔɔ tʉ̌ ngɔ̂ɔ, ńgÿo tʉ̌ nkáb, é gwɔ́ shúm sie mefùɔ ntsèm pie ée tsɛ̀ɛ ngwòŋ Alabi, mbɔɔ sie mengúmnɔ̀ɔn pie ée tsɛ̀ɛ ngwòŋ la lɔg ńtó, ńnáa mbwó fùɔ Salémo.
en: besides what was brought by the merchants and traders. All the Arabian kings and governors of the land also brought gold and silver to Solomon.

ngiemboon: Afùɔ Salémo gÿo mé tsó tʉ̌ ngɔ̂ɔ, ńdɔg nyɛte memǎa mekʉ́ʼʉ ncù nkÿo pʉ́a, ńdɔgɔ tʉ̌ ngɔ̂ɔ mekílò ntɔgɔ́ ńnyɛte tàʼ,
en: King Solomon made two hundred large shields of hammered gold; 15 pounds   of hammered gold went into each shield.

ngiemboon: ńgíŋe ńgÿo mé tsó tʉ̌ ngɔ̂ɔ, ńdɔg ńnyɛte púɔ mekʉ́ʼʉ ncù nkÿo tá, ńdɔgɔ tàʼ kílò né tsěm, ńnyɛte tàʼ; fùɔ Salémo tsẅi mé tÿɔ́gɔ tsɛ̀ɛ ndá gie mé tóŋo lê «mbím gie ée Limbaŋ».
en: He made three hundred small shields of hammered gold; 7 1/2 pounds   of gold went into each shield. The king put them in the House of the Forest of Lebanon.  # 9:16 1Kg 7:2–5

ngiemboon: Afùɔ Salémo lɔg lesoŋ shÿɔ́ɔ ńnyɛte máa lʉŋe lefùɔ, ńdɔgɔ tʉ̌ ngɔ̂ɔ gie á ŋwʉ́ŋe, ńkẅiŋ.
en: The king also made a large ivory throne and overlaid it with pure gold.

ngiemboon: Yɛ̌ lʉŋe lefùɔ la gẅiin mesetɔ̂b ntɔgɔ́, atsɔ́ setɔ̂b gwɔ́ gie à tÿɔ́gɔ mekwò mé mǒ, mbà mé la lɔgɔ tʉ̌ ngɔ̂ɔ ńnyɛte. Yɛ̌ kwɔ̀ʼɔ la gẅiin lezabá mbwó na yɛ̌ yɛ̌ gwǒŋ wɔ́ɔ. Mé la gʉa mǒ, ńkwóon mepúʼntʉ̀ mémbʉ́a á na gwoŋó pwó yetʉ̀ mbɔɔ yekyɛ̀bɛ.
en: The throne had six steps; there was a footstool covered in gold for the throne, armrests on either side of the seat, and two lions standing beside the armrests.

ngiemboon: Mé la gíŋ ńgÿo mepúʼntʉ̀ ntsɔ̀b pʉ́a né legém, ńtÿɔ́g ntɔgɔ́ na gwoŋó yekyɛ̀bɛ, ńtÿɔ́g ntɔgɔ́ na gwǒŋ yetʉ̀. Mé laa zɔɔn ńgÿo tsɔ́ páʼ yɛ̌ na tsɔ́ lefùɔ wɔ́.
en: Twelve lions were standing there on the six steps, one at each end. Nothing like it had ever been made in any other kingdom.

ngiemboon: Mentúʼ fùɔ Salémo ntsèm mbɔɔ shúm ndá sé sie é laa tsɛ̀ɛ ndá gie mé tóŋ lê «mbím Limbaŋ» é la pú ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ sé tʉ̌ ngɔ̂ɔ gie á ŋwʉ́ŋe ŋwʉŋe. Mé la te lɔgɔ tʉ̌ nkáb, ńnyɛte tsɔ́ mmó yé wɔ́, á nue á laa fʉ̀ʼ gie fùɔ Salémo laa fùɔ, nkáb te tsɔ́ mmó wɔ́.
en: All of King Solomon’s drinking cups were gold, and all the utensils of the House of the Forest of Lebanon were pure gold. There was no silver, since it was considered as nothing in Solomon’s time,

ngiemboon: Afùɔ Salémo la gẅiin melánzì mie à lɔ́ɔn ńtúmo ngʉ̀a shʉ̀shʉ̀a; pashwoŋo lâ pʉ̀a fùɔ Hilam. Pɔ́ lɔ́ɔn ńdɔgɔ mengùʼ njÿó méntá ntsèm, ńtóo ńtsege tʉ̌ ngɔ̂ɔ, mbɔɔ ye nkáb, mbɔɔ lesoŋ shÿɔ́ɔ, ńgÿo menkʉ̌a, mbɔɔ meshʉ̌ŋ pie é sí tɛʼ.
en: for the king’s ships kept going to Tarshish   with Hiram’s servants, and once every three years the ships of Tarshish would arrive bearing gold, silver, ivory, apes, and peacocks.  # 9:21 Or baboons

ngiemboon: Afùɔ Salémo la lɔg shúm fùʼ sé mbɔɔ zsénò yé, ńcʉa mefùɔ ntsèm ndùmo ssé tsetsáʼ.
en: King Solomon surpassed all the kings of the world in riches and wisdom.

ngiemboon: Mefùɔ ndùmo ssé tsetsáʼ ntsèm lɔ̌ɔn faʼa fùɔ Salémo lé júʼu zsénò gie Ssé la ná né yé.
en: All the kings of the world wanted an audience with Solomon to hear the wisdom God had put in his heart.

ngiemboon: Wɛ̌ nyìŋ wɔ́ɔ lɔ̌ɔn ńtóo ńnáa sé shúm nkáb, mbɔɔ mé metʉ̌ ngɔ̂ɔ, mbɔɔ menzsǒ lâ shúm ncù, mbɔɔ mevɛ́ gyě, mbɔɔ melÿóon, ńgÿo menzìkalÿóon. Á lɔ́ɔn ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ púʼu ngùʼ ntsèm.
en: Each of them would bring his own gift #— #items   of silver and gold, clothing, weapons,  # 9:24 LXX reads resin,# 9:24 Or fragrant balsam spices, and horses and mules #— #as an annual tribute.

ngiemboon: Afùɔ Salémo la gẅiin mendá mie ngwɔ́ melÿóon kúu wó ntsáʼ lekùɔ, mbɔɔ mekélêg ntsáʼ lekùɔ. À la gẅiin melÿóon ntsáʼ ntsɔ̀b pʉ́a né legém (12 000), ńdéʼe petsɔ́, á lejʉ́ŋ yé, á Yelúzálèm, ńtúm petsɔ́ ńnáa na tsɛ̀ɛ metÿǒsoŋ mie mé la nyɛte lélɔg ńdeʼe wɔ́b.
en: Solomon   had four thousand stalls for horses and chariots, and twelve thousand horsemen.  # 9:25 1Kg 4:26 He stationed them in the chariot cities and with the king in Jerusalem.

ngiemboon: Afùɔ Salémo lɔ̌ɔn ḿbú ésáʼa mefùɔ tà fó ngʉ̀ŋe mí Efalad, ńgʉa ńkúu ngwòŋ pʉ̀a Filisi, ńgʉa gʉa ńkúu ndège láʼa pʉ̀a Egíbtò.
en: He ruled over all the kings from the Euphrates River to the land of the Philistines and as far as the border of Egypt.

ngiemboon: Afùɔ Salémo la gÿo nkáb gyɔ́ɔn Yelúzálèm páʼ mekwaʼá la; à la gÿo memǎa metÿǒ mie mé tóŋo lê sɛ́ɛndèle é gyɔ́ɔn páʼ metÿǒ mie mé tóŋo lê sikomɔɔ la, é mie é sáʼa Shÿefela.
en: The king made silver as common in Jerusalem as stones, and he made cedar as abundant as sycamore in the Judean foothills.

ngiemboon: Melÿóon fùɔ Salémo lɔ́ɔn fóo Egíbtò mbɔɔ tsɛ̀ɛ tsɔ́ meláʼ tà ńgyɔ́ɔn.
en: They were bringing horses for Solomon from Egypt and from all the countries.

ngiemboon: Apfwɔ̀ʼɔ píte na nò fùɔ Salémo tà fó nzyeté ńgʉa ńkúu nzsoté, áa tsɛ̀ɛ membuʼú meŋwàʼne mie mé tóŋ lê ŋwàʼŋe mefàʼ ntsẅìnkʉ̀ Ssé Nataŋ, ńgwɔ́ tsɛ̀ɛ ye ntsẅìnkʉ̀ Ssé Ayiya, nyìŋ Silo mbɔɔ na menò mie e Ssé la nyɛ́ʼ nÿɔ́g Endo, ngyàjʉʼ, á gɔɔn ńtí Yelobowam míŋ Nembad.
en: The remaining events   of Solomon’s reign, from beginning to end, are written in the Events of the Prophet Nathan, the Prophecy of Ahijah the Shilonite, and the Visions of the Seer Iddo concerning Jeroboam son of Nebat.  # 9:29 1Ch 29:29; 2Ch 12:15; 13:22

ngiemboon: Afùɔ Salémo la néŋe na lʉŋ á Yelúzálèm, ésáʼ pʉ̀a Ésàlayɛ ntsèm na ngùʼ móm lekùɔ.
en: Solomon reigned in Jerusalem over all Israel for forty years.

ngiemboon: Afùɔ Salémo la táa ńkwé, mé tuŋó yé Yelúsálèm, á jʉʼ gie mé tóŋ lê tÿǒsoŋ fùɔ Ndavîd. Lombowam míŋ we wembàŋa jÿó ndá yé, ńcʉ́ʼʉ fùɔ.
en: Solomon rested with his ancestors and was buried in the city of his father David.   His son Rehoboam became king in his place.
